result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E Alloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel E Alloway is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel E Alloway was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid within first 30 days of probation.
No consumption or possession of alcohol and not to enter into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.
To be paid within first 30 days of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel E Alloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel E Alloway in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:15 AM. Alloway given complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Alloway understands charges and penalties, does not want an attorney, would like to plead G today. Court makes sure defendant understands what pleading today would/could result in. Alloway understands. Recess to fill out waiver of attorney form and plea questionnaire as DA will talk to defendant while in recess. Recalled at 9:44 AM with same appearances. State - have resolved the matter - dismiss count #2 and plead G/NC to count #1 as alleged, withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of costs. Alloway agrees. Court has waiver of right to attorney form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to an attorney, finds he is competent to proceed on his own and will allow him to do so. Alloway pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court dismisses count #2. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow recommendation. Alloway withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: $200 fine plus costs totalling $894.00 - paid within first 30 days of probation (includes DNA surcharge), no consumption or possession of alcohol and not to enter into any bars or taverns, AODA and follow thru, report to FOSO to submit DNA sample, gives rights for expungement on DNA, right to appeal, adjourned.
